when I first attained this dhÄraá¹‡Ä« teaching,

Know that this person
Will have been close to and respectfully made offerings to immeasurable koá¹­Ä«s of nayutas of hundreds of thousands of buddhas.
Planted various roots of goodness.
Why is this?
This Dharma is the great jeweled light-gathering of all buddhas and bodhisattvas.
World-Honored One.
If there are sentient beings who commit extremely evil karma,
Slander all buddhas, bodhisattvas, pratyekabuddhas, and Å›rÄvakas,
And slander the true Dharma, saying it has no goodness,
Or destroy the images, stÅ«pas, sÅ«tras, Å›Ästras, and teachings of buddhas, bodhisattvas, pratyekabuddhas, and Å›rÄvakas,
This person will fall into AvÄ«ci Hell,
And for countless eons will experience uninterrupted suffering.
The buddhas, bodhisattvas, pratyekabuddhas, and Å›rÄvakas,
Although possessing spiritual powers, are also unable to save them.
World-Honored One, such sentient beings are able to give rise to a repentant mind, bathe themselves clean,
Anoint their bodies with fragrance, and put on fresh clean clothes.
In accordance with the Dharma, in front of the Buddha,
Singly and with utmost sincerity, repent of the grave offenses they have committed in the past and in this life.
They will never commit them again.
They uphold the precepts and purify their minds.
For seven days and seven nights, they refrain from speaking and discussing.

They recite this dhÄraá¹‡Ä« mantra one hundred and eight times each day.
One should know that the offenses committed by that person in past and present lives,
The ten evil deeds, the five heinous crimes, and the four grave offenses,
Will all be eradicated without remainder, and they will not fall into hell.
They will only experience the light retribution of the five heinous crimes in the present life.
How can this be known?
It is said that for one day, two days, three days, four days,
Up to seven days, they will have malaria, fever,
Or suffering from eyes, ears, nose, tongue, palate, gums, teeth, head, back,
Both shoulders, heart, stomach, abdomen, ribs, waist, thighs,
Both arms, both knees, hemorrhoids, dysentery, cholera,
Hand and foot pain, white leprosy, wind sores,ğŸ”½Itching, scabies, boils, wandering swellings, carbuncles,
Blisters, itching, madness, and poisoning.
Or being disturbed by ghosts and spirits,
Or being slandered by various people,ğŸ”½Insulted and abused,
Whipped and beaten, imprisoned, and suffering various hardships,
Encountering other bad things or having inauspicious dreams,
World-Honored One, this person will lightly receive
And be able to ward off all the severe suffering and heavy karmic retribution of hell.
How much more so for sentient beings with pure faith and light offenses,
Who uphold this dhÄraá¹‡Ä« mantra and do not accomplish it?
If there are sentient beings whose body and mind are uneasy,
For various calamities, misfortunes, fears, bad dreams, and inauspiciousness,
Read and recite it daily with purity.
If one burns incense and makes offerings, then one will be able to eliminate them.
World-Honored One, if there are good men and good women,
who write it according to the Dharma, uphold it, read it, and recite it,
listen to this Dharma, and expound and praise it for others according to the Dharma,
teach others to write it, uphold it, read it, and recite it,
and widely cause all sentient beings born from wombs, eggs, moisture, or by transformation,
to hear this dhÄraá¹‡Ä« mantra samÄdhi,
they will all be liberated from all karmic hindrances.
These good men and good women,
should purify their minds,
contemplate in accordance with the principles,
with the wisdom of non-attainment and no location,
the wisdom of no self, no person, no recipient, and no discrimination,
the wisdom of no birth, no cessation, and no slow action,
the wisdom of no creation, no defilement, and equality,
the wisdom of effort in abandoning the five aggregates of form, sound, smell, taste, and touch, and not grasping or rejecting.
With this kind of skillful wisdom of suchness,
controlling the mind and taking it as a skillful means,
contemplating and recollecting the buddhas, always seeing them in front,
before long one will attain the manifestation of the buddhas of the ten directions and hundreds of thousands of worlds, all appearing before one at the same time.
They will pat one on the head, praise, and serve as witnesses.
Or one will attain good signs in dreams.
Or the buddhas will transform into Å›ramaá¹‡as
and bestow upon the bodhisattva the supreme precepts.
Causing immeasurable hundreds of thousands of kalpas of grave offenses to be extinguished.
Up to writing this sÅ«tra according to the Dharma,ğŸ”½placing it in the home and making offerings of various fragrances and flowers,
respectfully bowing with a devoted mind.
The merit attained is also like this.
The World-Honored One now briefly explains a small portion.
If there are sentient beings who, for the sake of surpassing others, are jealous, deceitful, and deceptive in their minds,
or due to fear, profit, or trifling reasons, rely on others' minds,
to read, recite, listen to, and receive this dhÄraá¹‡Ä« mantra samÄdhi,
Will all attain victory.
Or if after hearing it, they slander and despise it,
And do not revere it, they will also attain victory.
The World-Honored One, this benefit is only known by the greatly wise ones.
It is the power of the majestic spiritual influence of the Tathagata Sarvarthasiddha,
And it is the power of Avalokitesvara's great compassion.
It causes all evil beings and sentient beings
To plant immeasurable wholesome roots upon merely hearing it once.
Why is it so?
World-Honored One, it is like a person who, with a foolish and evil mind,
Goes to a forest of dragon brain sandalwood, white sandalwood, or aloeswood, or to any fragrant forest.
With foolish wisdom, they scold the fragrances in various ways.
They further give rise to an angry mind, slander the fragrances, saying that fragrances have no fragrance, pick the fragrances, chop them, cut them into pieces, and grind them into powder.
They mix them with water to drink or apply them to their bodies.
These fragrances have no mind and do not give them to them.
The nature of fragrances is fragrant and can permeate all unfragrant things, making them fragrant.
World-Honored One, this Heart of the Unfailing Lasso DhÄraá¹‡Ä« Mantra Samaya is also like this.
If there are sentient beings who speak of no cause and effect,
various slanders, false transgressions and faults,
or for the sake of jealousy, flattery, wealth, food, and all difficulties and hardships,
they should uphold, recite, and make offerings to it.
By these causes and conditions, they will attain great wholesome roots.
From this life onward, in all future lives,
they will always obtain the fragrance of precepts, the fragrance of concentration, the fragrance of wisdom, the fragrance of liberation,
the fragrance of the power of merit and virtue, and the fragrance of fearlessness.
The fragrance of the accumulation of merit and virtue that is solid and indestructible in all bodhisattvas,
the fragrance of the perfection of noble families and clans,
and will bring benefit.
World-Honored One, if good men and good women,
who uphold and recite this dhÄraá¹‡Ä« mantra,
should always on the eighth day of the waxing moon,
or on the fourteenth and fifteenth days of the waxing moon,
purify themselves by bathing and anoint their bodies with incense,
Wear clean clothes and eat the three white foods.
Or fast and refrain from all conversation.
In front of Avalokitesvara Bodhisattva of the Unfailing Lasso, sit in the proper manner.
Burn incense and make offerings, gazing at the bodhisattva's face.
Recite it seventy-seven times or one hundred and eight times.
World-Honored One, you should know that in this person's present life,
They will attain twenty praises, merits, and victorious benefits.
What are the twenty?
First, the body is free from all illnesses.
If illnesses from past karma arise, they will quickly be cured.
Second, the skin is delicate, soft, beautiful, and wonderful.
Third, people always look at it with love and never tire of it.
Fourth, the six sense faculties are always concentrated and wealth and treasures naturally come.
Fifth, clothes and treasures are not stolen by robbers.
Sixth, all wealth and treasures are not burned or swept away by water and fire.
Seventh, wealth and treasures are not forcibly taken by those who encroach, kill, and harm, causing starvation and death.
Eighth, they do not die by falling off cliffs.
Ninth, they empower pure ash and pure water.
Sprinkling all fruit, seedlings, and crops.
Evil winds, frost, hail, insects, and beasts,
All do not cause disasters, and seedlings flourish.
Tenth, they do not die in battlefields due to fighting and killing.
Eleventh, they do not die from being harmed by evil ghosts and spirits in the world who suck away essence and energy, or by seeking revenge.
Twelfth, they are always praised and admired by the masses.
They do not die at an evil time, but are cherished by others.
Thirteenth, if they see any non-Buddhist evil people, they naturally harmonize with them.
Fourteenth, they are not slandered or harmed by any evil people.
If anyone does rise up against them, they will quickly perish on their own.
Fifteenth, they are always fearless of all humans and non-humans.
Sixteenth, they do not die from the harm of worldly witchcraft, curses, or the Takiyoni ghost.
Seventeenth, all evil latent afflictions will naturally diminish.
Eighteenth, one will not be burned by water or fire, drowned,
or harmed by knives, arrows, poison, or poisonous insects.
Nineteenth, all the gods will always protect one.
Twentieth, in one's next life, one will be endowed with great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity, the four unobstructed minds.
World-Honored One, there are also eight dharmas. What are they?
First, at the time of death,
AvalokitÃªÅ›vara Bodhisattva will transform himself into the appearance of a Å›ramaá¹‡a,
and with skillful means, encourage and guide one to the buddha-land.
Second, at the time of death, the body will not be in pain.
One will be free to come and go, as if entering meditation.
Third, at the time of death, the eyes will not roll around, showing evil signs.
Fourth, at the time of death, the hands and feet will be at ease, and one will lie on the right side to die.
Fifth, at the time of death, one will not lose control of one's bowels or bladder, or die from diarrhea or blood in the stool.
Sixth, when facing the end of life, they do not lose right mindfulness and do not lie on their stomachs, but sit upright and die.
Seventh, when facing the end of life, they have various skillful means of expression.
They speak the profound and wonderful Dharma and then die.
Eighth, when facing the end of life, they vow to be reborn in a buddha-land.
According to their vow, they are reborn in the pure lands of buddhas.
They are born by transformation from a lotus flower.
They always behold all buddhas and bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas.
They are always irreversible.
World-Honored One, if there are sentient beings
who deeply delight in this Dharma, they should immediately explain it for them.
Some give rise to the aspiration to seek this Dharma to the end.
They accept and uphold it, read and recite it, and are also not stingy or jealous.
In accordance with the Dharma, they extensively distinguish and explain it.
Why is this?
Bodhisattvas always give rise to compassion and wisdom for all sentient beings.
They do not have a stingy, jealous mind.
Only then can they cultivate and practice the unsurpassed Dharma.
Moreover, bodhisattvas always diligently cultivate good dharmas for the sake of sentient beings.
Therefore, they are called true bodhisattvas.
What does it mean to say bodhisattva?
Bodhi means wisdom, and sattva means compassion.
It is the multitude of expedient means that are widely shown.
Based on these two dharmas, one benefits sentient beings.
One can then be called a bodhisattva.
World-Honored One, if you will allow me,
I will, for the benefit of all good men and good women,
And for those with evil views, nihilistic views, and bad wisdom,

I now also, for the benefit of all those with heavy defilements and little merit in the evil world,
And for those newly practicing bodhisattvas who abide in the MahÄyÄna,

Sva-ha
The common translations of sva-ha in ancient and modern times all do not
Investigate the clear and turbid of the Sanskrit sound, causing the chapters to differ from each other.
Some say sa-va-pa-ha, others say sa-va-pa-ka.
Some say sasvaha, pronounced as sasvaha.
Some say sasvaha, some say svaha.
Some say svaha.ğŸ”½Some say suvaha.ğŸ”½Some say shaka,
some say shaka.
The correct Sanskrit pronunciation does not have any original meaning.
This is not the correct transmission of the sound by a Sanskrit monk.
This is simply a mistake in writing.

Therefore, now it is determined to borrow the sound of the character sha pronounced as sha to be the character sha pronounced as sha, to borrow the sound of the character ba pronounced as ba to be the character ba pronounced as ba, and to borrow the sound of the character ha pronounced as ha to be the character ha pronounced as ha. This then correctly understands the holy sound and meaning.
Therefore, the Tang and Sanskrit scriptures cannot be without sound.
All the dharani at the end should be pronounced according to this.
At that time, Avalokitesvara Bodhisattva Mahasattva.
When he spoke this dharani,
he emitted light that illuminated Potala Mountain.
The palaces on the mountain shook six times.
In the sky,ğŸ”½It rained various heavenly blue lotus flowers, kuvalaya flowers,
red lotus flowers, punnÄga flowers,
mandÄra flowers, and various jeweled flowers.
Precious incense, jeweled crowns, heavenly garments,
pearl necklaces, bracelets, and various precious adornments, like clouds in the ocean,
Were offered to the TathÄgata and also offered to the great assembly gathered there.
The flowers reached up to the knees.
In the sky, countless heavenly musical instruments sounded without being played.
All the devas, nÄgas, yaká¹£as, rÄká¹£asas, asuras, gandharvas, kumbhÄá¹‡á¸as, kiá¹ƒnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans in the assembly,
Unanimously delighted, gazed up with palms joined in respect.
They praised in unison, saying, Excellent, excellent!
The greatly compassionate one is able to skillfully expound this infallible noose heart-mind king dhÄraá¹‡Ä« mantra samÄdhi.
If it is like a maá¹‡i jewel that is able to rain down great jeweled rains for sentient beings,
Will universally receive the moisture and attain liberation.
At that time, AvalokitÃªÅ›vara Bodhisattva MahÄsattva
Again addressed the Buddha, saying, World-Honored One.
This mother dhÄraá¹‡Ä« mantra,
If good men and good women,
At each time of the day, burn agarwood incense and recite it twenty-one times,
They will quickly be able to eliminate the ten evil deeds, the five heinous crimes, and the four grave offenses.
If traveling on a road, staying overnight, or dwelling in a place,
Or in a city, village, mountain, or marsh,
Reciting the mantra in the place where one resides,
The mantra empowers white mustard seeds.
Or further empowers pure water and pure ash to sprinkle and scatter to form a boundary.
The mantra for a khaá¸ga wood vajra nail.
The mantra for a five-colored thread rope.
Use it to tie the nail and nail it in the four directions.
It will then form a boundary and be a safe and secure dwelling.
There will be no fear, and it will be a great protection.
The mantra deity will be delighted.
The mantra for a white thread rope.
If worn by one suffering from malaria, it will be cured.
If worn on the arms, wrists, head, or waist of all people,
It will cause the wearer
To be cured of illness and to be at ease when frightened.
Consecrate ghee or black sesame oil,
And have those suffering from fever take it on an empty stomach, which will cure them.
If others curse or bewitch one,
Recite the mantra with a sword made of guest iron.
Conceal the sword on the body and limbs.
Also knead the person's form with flour.
One mantra and one sword.
Cut it into one hundred and eight pieces for seven days.
Do this every day, and they will then be cured.
If suffering from stomach pain,
Recite the mantra over red salt water and have them drink it, which will cure them.
If bitten by any poisonous insects,ğŸ”½Recite the mantra over yellow clay mud and apply it to the poisoned area several times.
Or recite the mantra over cow's milk several times and drink it on an empty stomach.
Or consecrate boiled bean juice.
The place bitten by the warm-soaking insect will then be cured.
If suffering from eye pain,
Recite the mantra on a white thread and use it to tie the earlobe.
Also, recite the mantra on bamboo juice, licorice, and sandalwood water.
Wash the eyes every morning, noon, and evening.
Or recite the mantra on water from a lotus pond.
Wash it daily and it will be cured.
If suffering from earache, tinnitus, hot wind,
Recite the mantra on black sesame oil or ghee.
Frequently drip it into the ears and it will be cured soon.
If the mantra practitioner consecrates a red thread with twenty-one knots,
Use it to tie around the waist and wrists, it will become a body protection.
If suffering from toothache,
Recite the mantra on a karavÄ«ra tree, hold it, and chew to massage the teeth.
If suffering from a ghost illness,
Consecrate a five-colored thread and have them wear it, and they will be cured.
If suffering from poison, weapons, broken wounds, throat swelling, boils, or malignant sores,
After reciting the mantra, sprinkle cow's milk powder and rock candy on the affected area and have the patient consume it. It will then be cured.
If there are disputes that have arisen or are about to arise,
every morning, facing the sun,
recite the mantra over pure water, wash the face, and rinse the mouth. It will then be resolved.
If there is chaos in the country, if a great minister plots rebellion,
if there is invasion by foreign troops, or if calamities and epidemics occur,
first take a clean bath, put on new clean clothes, and eat the three white foods.
For twenty-one days, strictly uphold the ritual arena.
In the four corners and center, place vases of perfumed water.
On the designated day, purify the inside and outside, and make offerings in accordance with the Dharma.
To the west or north of the altar, burn incense and scatter flowers.
Sit in accordance with the Dharma.
Recite this dhÄraá¹‡Ä« mantra, without letting the sound cease.
Perform the rite of dispelling calamities for twenty-one days.
It will then bring great peace to the entire country and people.
At each time of the day, empower the water in the vase in the ritual arena.
Sprinkle it on all people.
It will provide protection again.
Calamities, misfortunes, and karmic hindrances will naturally be eradicated.
If one loses one's voice due to sudden misfortune from ghosts and spirits,
Empower white sandalwood paste,
Smear it all over the heart, and one will return to normal.
If one does not have wealth, food and drink, incense, and flowers to make constant offerings,
But recites and upholds it without interruption,
One will also be able to eradicate all karmic hindrances.
If one wishes to have the good spirits protect one's home and prevent calamities and illnesses,
One should take one hundred and eight lotus flowers every day,
Smear them with ghee and honey,
Scatter white sandalwood incense powder, empower it, and perform homa.
Three times a day, recite one hundred and eight times each time.
After seven days,
One will achieve protection and eliminate all calamities and misfortunes.
If one wishes to bring joy to many people,
Empower ghee, honey, and white sandalwood incense,
Perform homa one hundred and eight times, and one will attain one's wishes. A verse says:

Seven treasures, clothes, pearl necklaces, and bracelets.

Using pure yellow earth and cow-head sandalwood incense paste,
Apply to the altar according to the Dharma, and paint the colors clean.
Place the image in the center, decorated with banners and flowers.

The mantra practitioner should diligently serve according to the Dharma day and night.
Always bathe clean and wear clean clothes.
At each session, facing east, burn incense, scatter flowers, sit in the proper posture according to the Dharma, and gaze at the Bodhisattva.
Recite the mantra according to the Dharma, without missing the proper number of times.
On the eighth day of each bright month, one should fast and recite diligently.

Second, the sign of smoke;
Third, the sign of light.
Dab on the forehead, dab on the eyes,
dab on the palms of both hands, dab on the soles of both feet,
and one will attain the samadhi of the wisdom adornment of supernatural powers of the king of Amoghavajra.
All activities
will be accomplished without fail.
At that time, the Tathagata praised Avalokitesvara Bodhisattva-Mahasattva, saying:
Excellent, excellent, good man!
You are able to, in this great assembly of devas and humans,
ignite the great Dharma torch, create a multitude of treasures, and lead all sentient beings out of the root of various sufferings.
At that time, the King of the Pure Abode, the King of Isana, the King of Mahesvara, the King of Great Brahma, the King of Shakra, and the various kings,
having heard this teaching, were all greatly delighted.
joined palms in respect, rose from their seats together, and addressed the Buddha, saying:
